Tyler_Dickerson:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Tyler Dickerson | image = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1993}}{{cite web|url=http://blog.gactv.com/blog/2009/12/14/tyler-dickerson-a-potential-counterpunch-to-commercial-country/|title=Tyler Dickerson: A Potential Counterpunch to Commercial Country|last=Roland|first=Tom|date=14 December 2009|work=[[Great American Country]]|access-date=3 March 2010}} | birth_place = [[Hattiesburg, Mississippi]], U.S. | origin = | instrument = Vocals | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer | years_active = early 2000s-present | label = [[Lyric Street Records|Lyric Street]] | associated_acts = Rockin Rouge }} '''Tyler Dickerson''' (born 1993 in [[Hattiesburg, Mississippi]]) is an American [[country music]] artist signed to [[Lyric Street Records]]. He released his debut [[single (music)|single]], "Tell Your Sister I'm Single," to radio in early 2010. ==Biography== Tyler Dickerson was born in [[Hattiesburg, Mississippi]] to Steven and Crystal Dickerson. He began performing at an early age, and by eleven he had started performing at venues in [[Florida]]. In 2005, he won Florida Male Vocalist and Male Entertainer of the Year awards for his age group.{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=888&dat=20051109&id=TrsNAAAAIBAJ&sjid=hnIDAAAAIBAJ&pg=4016,4609483|title=A real crowd-pleaser: Eleven-year-old Tyler Dickerson is on his way to becoming a star in the country music industry|last=Miller|first=Michelle|date=9 November 2005|work=Pasco Times|pages=3|access-date=3 March 2010}} He had also become a regular performer at [[Tootsie's Orchid Lounge]] in [[Nashville, Tennessee]].{{cite web|url=http://www.countrystandardtime.com/news/newsitem2.asp?xid=3792|title=Tyler Dickerson releases debut single|date=14 February 2010|work=[[Country Standard Time]]|access-date=3 March 2010}} Dickerson signed to a recording contract with [[Lyric Street Records]] in late 2009 after entering a talent search associated with [[John Rich]] of [[Big & Rich]], who also mentored him.{{cite web|url=http://communities.canada.com/REGINALEADERPOST/blogs/ploughboymansion/archive/2010/03/01/tyler-dickerson-s-career-is-on-the-move.aspx|title=Tyler Dickerson's career is on the move|last=Dedekker|first=Jeff|date=1 March 2010|work=The Leader-Post|access-date=3 March 2010|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://archive.today/20120714091748/http://communities.canada.com/REGINALEADERPOST/blogs/ploughboymansion/archive/2010/03/01/tyler-dickerson-s-career-is-on-the-move.aspx|archive-date=14 July 2012}} He released his first [[single (music)|single]], "Tell Your Sister I'm Single," in February 2010. The song is written by Amanda Williams, Trevor Rosen, and Isaac Rich (brother of John Rich). Dickerson also signed on as an opening act for [[Brooks & Dunn]]'s Last Rodeo Tour.{{cite web|url=http://www.theboot.com/2010/02/26/tyler-dickerson-tour/|title=Tyler Dickerson to Join Brooks & Dunn's Last Rodeo Tour|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|date=26 February 2010|work=The Boot|access-date=3 March 2010}} Bobby Peacock of Roughstock gave the song a positive review, saying that Dickerson "clearly plays the premise for laughs."{{cite web|url=http://www.roughstock.com/blog/tyler-dickerson-tell-your-sister-i-m-single-|title=Tyler Dickerson — "Tell Your Sister I'm Single"|last=Peacock|first=Bobby|date=29 January 2010|work=Roughstock|access-date=3 March 2010|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100202160351/http://www.roughstock.com/blog/tyler-dickerson-tell-your-sister-i-m-single-|archive-date=2 February 2010}} "Tell Your Sister I'm Single" debuted at number 51 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] charts dated for the week ending March 13, 2010. Dickerson now sings in the Louisiana-based band Rockin Rouge. Dickerson auditioned for ''[[The Voice (U.S. season 9)|The Voice]]'' on September 28, 2015. He performed "[[Hard to Handle (song)|Hard to Handle]]," and was chosen by [[Blake Shelton]] (the only one who turned his chair) to be on his team. He was eliminated from the show in the top 48, after losing to Zach Seabaugh on a performance of [[Travis Tritt]]'s "[[I'm Gonna Be Somebody]]." {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%; line-height:16px;" |- ! scope="col" | Stage ! scope="col" | Song ! scope="col" | Original Artist ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Order ! scope="col" | Result |- ! scope="row" | Blind Audition | "[[Hard to Handle (song)|Hard to Handle]]" | [[Otis Redding]] | September 28, 2015 | 3.13 | [[Blake Shelton]] turned
Defaulted to Team Blake |- ! scope="row" | The Battles (Top 48) | "[[I'm Gonna Be Somebody]]" (vs. Zach Seabaugh) | [[Travis Tritt]] | October 12, 2015 | 7.2 | Defeated |} {{Cite web|url=http://rockinrouge.com/|title=Rockin' Rouge' Rockin, Your Good Times Band|website=rockinrouge.com|access-date=2019-05-15}} ==Discography== ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Single ! colspan="1"| Peak positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="50"| [[Hot Country Songs|US Country]] |- | 2010 ! scope="row"| "Tell Your Sister I'm Single" | 47 |- | colspan="10" style="font-size:8pt"| "—" denotes releases that did not chart |- |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{The Voice (U.S.)}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dickerson, Tyler}} [[Category:1993 births]] [[Category:American child singers]] [[Category:American country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:American male singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Lyric Street Records artists]] [[Category:Singer-songwriters from Mississippi]] [[Category:Musicians from Hattiesburg, Mississippi]] [[Category:Date of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:The Voice (franchise) contestants]] [[Category:21st-century American singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Country musicians from Mississippi]] [[Category:21st-century American male singers]]
